intro: Mentha kitaibeliana, commonly known as the Japanese mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that have a serrated margin. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale purple to white and bloom in the summer months. Mentha kitaibeliana is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb, similar to other mint species.
